H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1683.def: = flying insect that collects nectar from flowers and converts it into honey; lives in swarms made up of many thousands of insects; stings only when threatened; ≈ with connotations ranging from positive (food producing) to negative (as a metaphor for an army of well-organized enemies

H1301.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5068.def: = causative action by which humans are made willing by their inner person to perform a certain task

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H7336.def: used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2167.def: = action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H8165.def: = man; ► regarded as founder of an ethnic group bearing the same name, and living in an area named after him as well

H6805.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5514.def: = mountain and surrounding desert on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, also known as Mount {L:Horeb<SDBH:חֹורֵב>}; ► location where {L:YHWH<SDBH:יהוה>} entered into a {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} with {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H8044.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Anath<SDBH:עֲנָת>}; ► judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, who killed 600 {L:Philistines<SDBH:פְּלִשְׁתִּי>} with an ox-{L:goad<SDBH:מַלְמַד>}

H3278.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6520.def: = class of people living in villages and other unfortified population centers in the rural areas

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H7420.def: = a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H2686.def: = action by which insects divides themselves into orderly groups ◄ like an army

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H7028.def: = river; ◄ that drains the western portion of the Plain of Esdraelon from {L:Megiddo<SDBH:מְגִדֹּו>} to the sea, fed by springs from {L:Gilboa<SDBH:גִּלְבֹּעַ>} and the foot of the {L:Carmel<SDBH:כַּרְמֶל>} range; ► location where {L:Sisera<SDBH:סִיסְרָא>} was defeated and where {L:Elijah<SDBH:אֵלִיָּהוּ>} killed the prophets of {L:Baal<SDBH:בַּעַל>}

H1640.def: = causative action by which a body of water removes humans from their place with force

H6917.def: = pertaining to having been in existence for a very long time

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H6119.def: = the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H1726.def: = action by which a horse walks at a fast pace, with all the feet off the ground together in each stride

H47.def: = male bovine; ≈ symbol of deities and associated with power and strength, but also with aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H779.def: = to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so

H4789.def: = town; ◄ north of {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}; ► cursed by {L:Deborah<SDBH:דְּבֹורָה>} because of their unwillingness to help {L:Barak<SDBH:בָּרָק>}'s army in their fight against the army of {L:Sisera<SDBH:סִיסְרָא>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H3278.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H2268.def: = state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

H7017.def: = ethnic group; ◄ possibly descendants of {L:Cain<SDBH:קַיִן>}; ► ally of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; associated with {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>}' father-in-law

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H5602.def: = receptacle of undetermined size; ► used for drinking

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H2529.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3489.def: = small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1989.def: = instrument of about 30 centimeters long, consisting of a handle, usually made of wood, to which was attached a stone, wooden, or (less frequently) metal head; ► used for many purposes, including the breaking or dressing of building stones, pounding nails or pegs into wood, or pounding pegs into the ground; also used by blacksmiths to shape hot metal

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H4277.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4272.def: = action by which humans strike other humans or animals with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H7541.def: = either side of the human head between the forehead and the ear

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H2474.def: = an opening ◄ in the wall of a building, ► which admits light and often air to a room and allows its occupants to look out, or objects within to be seen; in some cases they can be opened and closed; sometimes used as secret entrance or exit; ≈ has therefore some connonations of secrecy

H822.def: = window with bars or strips crossing each other with spaces left between

H2980.def: = action by which humans look intently in a certain direction

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H309.def: = process by which an event happens later than expected

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H4818.def: = open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6648.def: = dyed cloth of high quality; ≈ highly valued

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H7553.def: = cloth with decorative patterns sewn into it by hand and therefore expensive; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H705.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number
